definition: to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)

sentences.english: Then, golden eagle came out, lonely chanted among my palm prints.
sentences.chinese: 然後，金雕出現，在我的掌紋間孤獨歌吟。

sentences.english: Lord, what is this chant, what magic art.
sentences.chinese: 主啊，這是什麼歌吟，魔術般力量？

sentences.english: I stood in the songs of childhood Yin, the backdrop of the poetry.
sentences.chinese: 我的童年矗立在歌吟裏，掩映在詩詞中。

sentences.english: Singing, dancing and giggling in my dream.
sentences.chinese: 在我夢裏咯咯輕笑，歡舞歌吟。

sentences.english: May love be melted in memory, and sadness converted into song.
sentences.chinese: 讓愛融在記憶裏，讓痛苦化作歌吟。

definition: to chant/to recite rhythmically/to polish verse
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
to sing and dance/general term for a round dance
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
to do sth to one's heart's content
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
reed-pipe wind instrument and vertical bamboo flute
to sing loudly/to lift one's voice in song
